StataDTAFiles.jl

  • Readme

    Docstrings
    StataDTAFiles.ByteOrder
    StataDTAFiles.ByteOrderIO
    StataDTAFiles.DATANUMTYPES — Constant.

    Number types is Stata that correspond to native Julia types, and are denoted by the latter.

    StataDTAFiles.DTAFile — Type.
    struct DTAFile{T<:NamedTuple, B<:StataDTAFiles.ByteOrderIO}

    Representation of a Stata DTA file for which everything except the data itself has been read.

    The data (rows) can be read as NamedTuples, using the iteration interface.

    StataDTAFiles.DTAHeader — Type.
    struct DTAHeader

    DTA file header (without the byte order, which is encoded in the corresponding ByteOrderIO.

    StataDTAFiles.DTAMap
    StataDTAFiles.EPOCH — Constant.

    Start of the epoch, ie "day 0" for most date handling functions in Stata.

    Note

    Don't use directly, see elapsed_days.

    StataDTAFiles.EXTRANUMTYPES — Constant.

    Number types which are read by readnum, in addition to DATANUMTYPES.

    StataDTAFiles.MAXFLOAT32

    StataDTAFiles.MAXINT32
    StataDTAFiles.MAXINT8
    StataDTAFiles.MSF
    StataDTAFiles.READNUMTYPES — Constant.

    All number types read by readnum.

    StataDTAFiles.STRFSMAXLEN — Constant.

    Maximum length of str# (aka strfs) strings in Stata DTA files.

    StataDTAFiles.StataDTAFiles
    StataDTAFiles.TIMESTAMPFMT — Constant.

    Date format of Stata file timestamps.

    StataDTAFiles._readrow
    StataDTAFiles.decode_missing
    StataDTAFiles.decode_variable_type — Function.
    decode_variable_type(code)

    Map the numerical type code in a DTA file to a Julia type.

    Note that numeric types use a sentinel for missing values, and thus are decoded as Union{Missing, T} for the corresponding type T.

    StataDTAFiles.elapsed_days — Function.
    elapsed_days(Δ)

    Convert a Stata "elapsed date" representation into Date.

    Corresponds to the %td format in Stata.

    StataDTAFiles.eval
    StataDTAFiles.include
    StataDTAFiles.read_formats — Function.
    read_formats(boio, header, map)

    Read the format strings, returning a Vector{String}.

    StataDTAFiles.read_header
    StataDTAFiles.read_map
    StataDTAFiles.read_sortlist — Function.
    read_sortlist(boio, header, map)

    Read the sortlist, a vector if integers which contains column indexes for nested sorting.

    StataDTAFiles.read_variable_names — Function.
    read_variable_names(boio, header, map)

    Read variable names, returning a tuple of Symbols.

    StataDTAFiles.read_variable_types — Function.
    read_variable_types(boio, header, map)

    Read variable types from a DTA file. Return a tuple of Julia types.

    StataDTAFiles.readbyteorder
    StataDTAFiles.readchompedstring — Function.
    readchompedstring(boio, len)

    Read chars into a buffer of length len, find the terminating "␀" (if any) and truncate, returning a string.

    readchompedstring(boio, T)

    Read length (of type T), then read and chomp the string.
